trans-unit.source: Conditional Access for Applications Published with Azure AD Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: Conditional Access for Applications Published with Azure AD Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Covers how to set up conditional access for applications you publish to be accessed remotely using Azure AD Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Covers how to set up conditional access for applications you publish to be accessed remotely using Azure AD Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Working with conditional access
trans-unit.target: Working with conditional access

trans-unit.source: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory editions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can now enable access rules to grant conditional access to users and groups accessing applications published using Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: You can now enable access rules to grant conditional access to users and groups accessing applications published using Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to:
trans-unit.target: This enables you to:

trans-unit.source: Require mutli-factor authentication per application
trans-unit.target: Require mutli-factor authentication per application

trans-unit.source: Require multi-factor authentication only when users are not at work
trans-unit.target: Require multi-factor authentication only when users are not at work

trans-unit.source: Block users from accessing the application when they are not at work
trans-unit.target: Block users from accessing the application when they are not at work

trans-unit.source: These rules can be applied to all users and groups or only to specific users and groups.
trans-unit.target: These rules can be applied to all users and groups or only to specific users and groups.

trans-unit.source: By default the rule will apply to all users who have access to the application.
trans-unit.target: By default the rule will apply to all users who have access to the application.

trans-unit.source: However the rule can also be restricted to users that are members of the specified security groups.
trans-unit.target: However the rule can also be restricted to users that are members of the specified security groups.

trans-unit.source: Access rules are evaluated when a user accesses a federated application that uses OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML or WS-Federation.
trans-unit.target: Access rules are evaluated when a user accesses a federated application that uses OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML or WS-Federation.

trans-unit.source: In addition, access rules are evaluated when the OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect when a refresh token is used to acquire an access token.
trans-unit.target: In addition, access rules are evaluated when the OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect when a refresh token is used to acquire an access token.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Conditional access prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Subscription to Azure Active Directory Premium
trans-unit.target: Subscription to Azure Active Directory Premium

trans-unit.source: A federated or managed Azure Active Directory tenant
trans-unit.target: A federated or managed Azure Active Directory tenant

trans-unit.source: Federated tenants require that multi-factor authentication (MFA) be enabled
trans-unit.target: Federated tenants require that multi-factor authentication (MFA) be enabled

trans-unit.source: Configure per-application multi-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure per-application multi-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: Sign in as an administrator in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in as an administrator in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Go to Active Directory and select the directory in which you want to enable Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Go to Active Directory and select the directory in which you want to enable Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Click Applications and scroll down to the Access Rules section.
trans-unit.target: Click Applications and scroll down to the Access Rules section.

trans-unit.source: The access rules section with only be shown for applications published using Application Proxy that use federated authentication.
trans-unit.target: The access rules section with only be shown for applications published using Application Proxy that use federated authentication.

trans-unit.source: Enable the rule by selecting Enable Access Rules to On.
trans-unit.target: Enable the rule by selecting Enable Access Rules to On.

trans-unit.source: Specify the users and groups to whom the rules will apply. Use the Add Group button to select one or more groups to which the access rule will apply. This dialog can also be used to remove selected groups. When the rules are selected to apply to groups, the access rules will only be enforced for users that belong to one of the specified security groups. To explicitly exclude security groups from the rule, check Except and specify one or more groups. Users who are members of a group in the Except list will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication. If a user was configured using the per-user multi-factor authentication feature, this setting will take precedence over the application multi-factor authentication rules. This means that a user who has been configured for per-user multi-factor authentication will be required to perform multi-factor authentication even if they have been exempted from the application's multi-factor authentication rules. Learn more about multi-factor authentication and per-user settings.
trans-unit.target: Specify the users and groups to whom the rules will apply. Use the Add Group button to select one or more groups to which the access rule will apply. This dialog can also be used to remove selected groups. When the rules are selected to apply to groups, the access rules will only be enforced for users that belong to one of the specified security groups. To explicitly exclude security groups from the rule, check Except and specify one or more groups. Users who are members of a group in the Except list will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication. If a user was configured using the per-user multi-factor authentication feature, this setting will take precedence over the application multi-factor authentication rules. This means that a user who has been configured for per-user multi-factor authentication will be required to perform multi-factor authentication even if they have been exempted from the application's multi-factor authentication rules. Learn more about multi-factor authentication and per-user settings.

trans-unit.source: Select the access rule you want to set:
trans-unit.target: Select the access rule you want to set:

trans-unit.source: Require Multi-factor authentication: Users to whom access rules apply will be required to complete multi-factor authentication before accessing the application to which the rule applies.
trans-unit.target: Require Multi-factor authentication: Users to whom access rules apply will be required to complete multi-factor authentication before accessing the application to which the rule applies.

trans-unit.source: Require Multi-factor authentication when not at work: Users trying to access the application from a trusted IP address will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Require Multi-factor authentication when not at work: Users trying to access the application from a trusted IP address will not be required to perform multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: The trusted IP address ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page.
trans-unit.target: The trusted IP address ranges can be configured on the multi-factor authentication settings page.

trans-unit.source: Block access when not at work: Users trying to access the application from outside your corporate network will not be able to access the application.
trans-unit.target: Block access when not at work: Users trying to access the application from outside your corporate network will not be able to access the application.

trans-unit.source: Configuring MFA for federation services
trans-unit.target: Configuring MFA for federation services

trans-unit.source: For federated tenants, multi-factor authentication (MFA) may performed by Azure Active Directory or by the on-premises AD FS server.
trans-unit.target: For federated tenants, multi-factor authentication (MFA) may performed by Azure Active Directory or by the on-premises AD FS server.

trans-unit.source: By default, MFA will occur on any page hosted by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: By default, MFA will occur on any page hosted by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: In order to configure MFA on-premises, run Windows PowerShell and use the –SupportsMFA property to set the Azure AD module.
trans-unit.target: In order to configure MFA on-premises, run Windows PowerShell and use the –SupportsMFA property to set the Azure AD module.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to enable on-premises MFA by using the Set-MsolDomainFederationSettings cmdlet on the contoso.com tenant: Set-MsolDomainFederationSettings -DomainName contoso.com -SupportsMFA $true
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to enable on-premises MFA by using the Set-MsolDomainFederationSettings cmdlet on the contoso.com tenant: Set-MsolDomainFederationSettings -DomainName contoso.com -SupportsMFA $true

trans-unit.source: In addition to setting this flag, the federated tenant AD FS instance must be configured to perform multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: In addition to setting this flag, the federated tenant AD FS instance must be configured to perform multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions for <link><linkText>Deploying Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication on-premises</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions for <link><linkText>Deploying Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication on-premises</linkText><title></title></link>.
